metadata.title: CVE-2012-2333 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer underflow in OpenSSL before 0.9.8x, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0j, and 1.0.1before 1.0.1c, when TLS 1.1, TLS 1.2, or DTLS is used with CBC encryption,allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer over-read) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted TLS packet that is notproperly handled during a certain explicit IV calculation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2333` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1-4ubuntu6
openssl - 1.0.1-4ubuntu6
No subscription required

libssl0.9.8 - 0.9.8o-7ubuntu3.2.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1-4ubuntu6').
openssl098 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.8o-7ubuntu3.2.14.04.1').
